snippet: Though many independent bookstores have blamed the giant online retailer for their struggles, there are signs of a thaw in tensions in Seattle, as many Amazon employees are buying books in brick-and-mortar shops.
abstract: Local bookstore owners in Seattle are surprised to learn that many Amazon employees working at company's downtown headquarters are readers who buy books in their brick-and-mortar stores; trend has led to thaw in relations between Amazon and independent bookstores, who have blamed giant online retailer for their financial struggles, and is helping to boost Seattle's reputation as a successful independent bookstore city.
lead_paragraph: Though many independent bookstores have blamed the giant online retailer for their struggles, there are signs of a thaw in tensions in Seattle, as many Amazon employees are buying books in brick-and-mortar shops.

headline.main: Bookstores in Seattle Soar, and Embrace an Old Nemesis: Amazon.com
headline.print_headline: Bookstores in Seattle Soar, and Embrace Old Nemesis
